contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=November 2007}} {{distinguish2|[[Fernando Pessoa]]}} '''Fernando Pessa''', <small>[[Order of Infante D. Henrique|ComIH]], [[Order of Merit (Portugal)|GOM]], [[Order of British Empire|OBE]]</small> (April 15, 1902 – April 29, 2002) was a [[Portugal|Portuguese]] journalist and reporter. Early in 2002, Pessa was hailed as the world's oldest journalist. He joined Portugal's state radio in 1934, and covered [[World War II]] for [[BBC]] radio, for which he was subsequently appointed an [[British honours system|Officer of the Order of the British Empire]] by [[George VI of the United Kingdom|King George VI]]. On March 7, 1957 Pessa made the first live television transmission of the [[Rádio e Televisão de Portugal|Portuguese Radio and Television]] service. {{Authority control|VIAF=45124649}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Pessa, Fernando | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = April 15, 1902 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = April 29, 2002 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Pessa, Fernando}} [[Category:1902 births]] [[Category:2002 deaths]] [[Category:Portuguese centenarians]] [[Category:Portuguese journalists]] {{Portugal-writer-stub}}
